intro: Icacorea triangula, commonly known as the three-angled coral tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its distinctive tri-lobed leaves and clusters of bright red or orange flowers. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing as a shrub or small tree. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for horticultural use due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability.
